title: Task Automation Tools/Scripts Built in R
text: CRAN still far popular repository R packages, find quite lot packages available GitHub. Furthermore, ’d liked try latest development versions automaton package install GitHub. can install package GitHub, need install remotes package CRAN. Now can install package GitHub providing "username/repository" argument remotes::install_github(). example, install latest development version {automaton} GitHub run command. Please note installing package GitHub means install source. requires proper development environment including (minimum) C FORTRAN compiler. Linux macOS ’s given Windows ’s . discuss difference installing binaries vs. installing source. Copyright (c) 2022 Mohit Shrestha, MSBA

what: Generate pseudorandom dataframes with specific parameters — generate_df
title: Generate pseudorandom dataframes with specific parameters — generate_df
text: function small utility create specific length dataframe set number groups, specific mean/sd per group. Note total length dataframe n * n_grps.

title: Generate pseudorandom dataframes with specific parameters — generate_df
code: generate_df(n = 10L, n_grps = 1L, with_seed = NULL, mean = c(10), sd = mean/10)

title: Generate pseudorandom dataframes with specific parameters — generate_df
text: n integer indicating number rows per group, default 10 n_grps integer indicating number rows per group, defaults 1 with_seed seed make randomization reproducible mean number indicating mean randomly generated values, must vector equal length n_grps sd number indicating standard deviation randomly generated values, must vector equal length n_grps

title: Generate pseudorandom dataframes with specific parameters — generate_df
text: tibble/dataframe

title: Generate pseudorandom dataframes with specific parameters — generate_df
code: generate_df() #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    row_id id    grp   values #>     <int> <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #>  1      1 Z10   grp-1  11.8  #>  2      2 A09   grp-1  11.5  #>  3      3 B07   grp-1  10.1  #>  4      4 F03   grp-1  11.1  #>  5      5 A07   grp-1  10.1  #>  6      6 O02   grp-1  11.0  #>  7      7 T05   grp-1  11.7  #>  8      8 J03   grp-1  12.3  #>  9      9 V10   grp-1   9.47 #> 10     10 W08   grp-1  11.9  generate_df(n = 100L, n_grps = 5L, with_seed = NULL, mean = seq(10, 50, length.out = 5)) #> # A tibble: 500 × 4 #>    row_id id    grp   values #>     <int> <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #>  1      1 Y061  grp-1   9.79 #>  2      2 G042  grp-1  10.0  #>  3      3 R078  grp-1  11.6  #>  4      4 I071  grp-1  11.1  #>  5      5 N063  grp-1   8.98 #>  6      6 N092  grp-1   9.43 #>  7      7 P020  grp-1   7.33 #>  8      8 E060  grp-1   9.93 #>  9      9 Z052  grp-1  10.6  #> 10     10 T100  grp-1   9.03 #> # ℹ 490 more rows  library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union generate_df(   100L,   n_grps = 5,   mean = seq(10, 50, length.out = 5) ) |>   group_by(grp) |>   summarise(     mean = mean(values), # mean is approx mean     sd = sd(values),     # sd is approx sd     n = n(),             # each grp is of length n     # showing that the sd default of mean/10 works     `mean/sd` = round(mean / sd, 1)   ) #> # A tibble: 5 × 5 #>   grp    mean    sd     n `mean/sd` #>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <int>     <dbl> #> 1 grp-1  9.96  1.00   100       9.9 #> 2 grp-2 20.1   1.80   100      11.1 #> 3 grp-3 29.9   3.12   100       9.6 #> 4 grp-4 40.2   4.41   100       9.1 #> 5 grp-5 49.8   5.44   100       9.1

title: Customize GT table — gt_theme_ms
text: Customize Table Theme gt Package.

title: Customize GT table — gt_theme_ms
text: gt_tbl Input GT table just data frame. First convert data frame/tibble GT table input gt table function

title: Customize GT table — gt_theme_ms
text: Returns gt table using customized theme

title: Customize GT table — gt_theme_ms
code: library(automaton) library(gt) #> Error in library(gt): there is no package called ‘gt’ tbl <- automaton::penguins gt_tbl <- tbl |>             dplyr::count(species) |>             gt() #> Error in gt(dplyr::count(tbl, species)): could not find function "gt"  gt_tbl |> gt_theme_ms() #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'gt_tbl' not found

title: Insert dashes. — insert_dashes
text: Call function addin insert dashes column 80.

title: Launch a new project-less RStudio session — launch_rstudio

what: The goal of palmerpenguins is to provide a great dataset for data exploration & visualization, as an alternative to iris. — penguins
title: The goal of palmerpenguins is to provide a great dataset for data exploration & visualization, as an alternative to iris. — penguins
text: data: Data collected made available Dr. Kristen Gorman Palmer Station, Antarctica LTER, member Long Term Ecological Research Network. palmerpenguins package contains two datasets. One called penguins, simplified version raw data; see ?penguins info.

title: The goal of palmerpenguins is to provide a great dataset for data exploration & visualization, as an alternative to iris. — penguins
The goal of palmerpenguins is to provide a great dataset for data exploration & visualization, as an alternative to iris. — penguins
text: tibble 344 rows 8 variables: species factor denoting penguin species (Adélie, Chinstrap Gentoo) island factor denoting island Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica (Biscoe, Dream Torgersen) bill_length_mm number denoting bill length (millimeters) bill_depth_mm number denoting bill depth (millimeters) flipper_length_mm integer denoting flipper length (millimeters) body_mass_g integer denoting body mass (grams) sex factor denoting penguin sex (female, male) year integer denoting study year (2007, 2008, 2009)

title: The goal of palmerpenguins is to provide a great dataset for data exploration & visualization, as an alternative to iris. — penguins
text: Adélie penguins: Palmer Station Antarctica LTER K. Gorman. 2020. Structural size measurements isotopic signatures foraging among adult male female Adélie penguins (Pygoscelis adeliae) nesting along Palmer Archipelago near Palmer Station, 2007-2009 ver 5. Environmental Data Initiative. doi:10.6073/pasta/98b16d7d563f265cb52372c8ca99e60f Gentoo penguins: Palmer Station Antarctica LTER K. Gorman. 2020. Structural size measurements isotopic signatures foraging among adult male female Gentoo penguin (Pygoscelis papua) nesting along Palmer Archipelago near Palmer Station, 2007-2009 ver 5. Environmental Data Initiative. doi:10.6073/pasta/7fca67fb28d56ee2ffa3d9370ebda689 Chinstrap penguins: Palmer Station Antarctica LTER K. Gorman. 2020. Structural size measurements isotopic signatures foraging among adult male female Chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarcticus) nesting along Palmer Archipelago near Palmer Station, 2007-2009 ver 6. Environmental Data Initiative. doi:10.6073/pasta/c14dfcfada8ea13a17536e73eb6fbe9e Originally published : Gorman KB, Williams TD, Fraser WR (2014) Ecological Sexual Dimorphism Environmental Variability within Community Antarctic Penguins (Genus Pygoscelis). PLoS ONE 9(3): e90081. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0090081

title: The goal of palmerpenguins is to provide a great dataset for data exploration & visualization, as an alternative to iris. — penguins
text: Size measurements adult foraging penguins near Palmer Station, Antarctica Includes measurements penguin species, island Palmer Archipelago, size (flipper length, body mass, bill dimensions), sex. subset penguins_raw.
